alert.note: Alert for Lafayette; Marshall; Union (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 03 at 4:56AM CST until March 03 at 9:08PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Mississippi... Little Tallahatchie Canal at Etta near New Albany affecting Marshall, Lafayette and Union Counties. For the Little Tallahatchie River...including Etta near New Albany... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Little Tallahatchie Canal at Etta near New Albany. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, County Road 47 near Mud Creek and Mill Creek has 6 to 12 inches of water over it. Several thousand acres of cropland are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 AM CST Friday the stage was 26.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:00 AM CST Friday was 26.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 26.5 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 26.6 feet on 03/30/1975. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 500 PM CST.
